summary.para: A BrightnessContrastParams structure contains members that specify the nature of a brightness or contrast adjustment.
You can change the brightness or contrast (or both) of a bitmap by following these steps.

item.description: Create and initialize a BrightnessContrastParams structure.
Pass the address of the BrightnessContrastParams structure to the method of a BrightnessContrast object.
Pass the address of the BrightnessContrast object to the Graphics.DrawImage method or to the method.

member.name: BrightnessContrastParams.brightnessLevel
member.summary: Integer in the range -255 through 255 that specifies the brightness level. If the value is 0, the brightness remains the same. As the value moves from 0 to 255, the brightness of the image increases. As the value moves from 0 to -255, the brightness of the image decreases.

member.name: BrightnessContrastParams.contrastLevel
member.summary: Integer in the range -100 through 100 that specifies the contrast level. If the value is 0, the contrast remains the same. As the value moves from 0 to 100, the contrast of the image increases. As the value moves from 0 to -100, the contrast of the image decreases.
